cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles WNW of Nassau, or about 180 miles SE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest through the north-western Bahamas today, then sliding north-northwest just offshore the Florida east coast before paralleling the coasts of Georgia and South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: closest coastal encounter is expected along Florida’s east coast near the area between West Palm Beach and Cape Canaveral

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida west coast north of Chokoloskee to Anclote River (includes Port Manatee/Tampa Bay area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida west coast from Anclote River to Suwannee River (north of Port Manatee)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast from north of Golden Beach to Edisto Beach SC under hurricane warning; additional tropical-storm conditions possible along parts of the Florida west coast under watch/warning areas
weather_observation.wind: Gusty conditions possible late Friday as outer rain-bands rotate across west-central Florida; 34-kt winds have a 47 % cumulative chance and peak 25 % onset probability, while 50-kt winds remain unlikely (7 %).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Gulf coast near Port Manatee because the cyclone remains on the Atlantic side.
weather_observation.rainfall: Occasional outer bands may bring 1–3 inches of rain, but widespread heavy rainfall is not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Choppy seas and dangerous rip currents in the near-shore Gulf waters could affect vessel handling and small-craft operations.
